TopicTitle: KSP Admin Building Staff Detailed In Shacknews

Articles.Content:
http://www.shacknews.com/article/86391/kerbal-space-program-introducing-administration-building-to-career-mode

I'm a little disappointed that this wasn't posted on the blog, but it looks good. It shows all the new canon characters. Anyone else think that the fact that the PR guy is wearing a HAZMAT suit is a bad message to the public?
Nah. The HAZMAT suit is made of ground-up SRB's and NERVAs, and the public knows it. So it's a good thing.

http://www.shacknews.com/article/86391/kerbal-space-program-introducing-administration-building-to-career-mode

I'm a little disappointed that this wasn't posted on the blog, but it looks good. It shows all the new canon characters. Anyone else think that the fact that the PR guy is wearing a HAZMAT suit is a bad message to the public?

But The HypeTrain posted the link in the thread first.

I'm gathering the first picture is of the scientist? Nothing else really makes sense...

Looking good, though.

That HAZMAT suit isn't going to help displace the insane destructible buildings secret update ravings. I like his given-up-trying stubble, though.

edit: And why is the lead accountant dressed up like a butler?

Edited September 20, 2014 by Franklin

edit: And why is the lead accountant dressed up like a butler?

I'm offended by this! I dress like that! It's a buisness suit.
A hazmat suit? Is the secret feature... radioactive fallout?

http://www.shacknews.com/article/86391/kerbal-space-program-introducing-administration-building-to-career-mode

I'm a little disappointed that this wasn't posted on the blog, but it looks good.

The forum/social posts were all scheduled for tomorrow. *Grumbles* Well, enjoy, though!

A hazmat suit? Is the secret feature... radioactive fallout?

No, it's just a neat visual. The costume, not the fallout...and no fallout, either.
Oh, great, now I've gotta write character stories for them. I'll be back...

The forum/social posts were all scheduled for tomorrow. *Grumbles* Well, enjoy, though!

Unlucky. Maybe you've got to be quicker?

Mortimer. A shout out to SimCity? Awesome.

Though the all use the generic kerbal face. It would be more interesting if they were more varied, like how Gene has no hair, and Wernher has a moustache.

Though the all use the generic kerbal face. It would be more interesting if they were more varied, like how Gene has no hair, and Wernher has a moustache.

Mort seems to have a little bit of wrinkles. Walt has a subtle beard stubble.

http://www.shacknews.com/article/86391/kerbal-space-program-introducing-administration-building-to-career-mode

I'm a little disappointed that this wasn't posted on the blog, but it looks good. It shows all the new canon characters. Anyone else think that the fact that the PR guy is wearing a HAZMAT suit is a bad message to the public?

call me crazy but i wonder if the facial characteristics of the first two characters (stubble, wrinkles) may be a harbinger of custom kerbal creation
Is Walt a Breaking Bad reference? Has to be.
Dang it, now I want the option to launch Kerbals in hazmat suits instead of spacesuits

Dang it, now I want the option to launch Kerbals in hazmat suits instead of spacesuits

Or the suits they use on kerbal because... they still aren't sure it's safe out there!

Unlucky. Maybe you've got to be quicker?

Mortimer. A shout out to SimCity? Awesome.

http://www.geocities.ws/gordeon/advisor_mortimer.gif

Though the all use the generic kerbal face. It would be more interesting if they were more varied, like how Gene has no hair, and Wernher has a moustache.

look at mortimer again good sir. he is quite well aged

edit: and the PR guy has stubble. i guess its hard to shave inside a hazmat suit.

edit 2: I posted this before reading the second page. I have been ninja'd by multiple people, and by over an hour *facepalm*

Edited September 20, 2014 by r4pt0r

Is Walt a Breaking Bad reference? Has to be.

Correctamundo!

Correctamundo!

That makes absolutely no sense that he is the PR guy then, he should definitely be the Science guy.

On closer inspection, seems you guys are right, though the differences are subtle. Still, giving them more distinct hair would be a plus. Then again, maybe that's something to be implemented later.

It's a pity they haven't completed the female Kerbal design yet, could have been an opportunity to have an important female character. Squad may have missed a trick here, unless there will be more in game charters added later.

call me crazy but i wonder if the facial characteristics of the first two characters (stubble, wrinkles) may be a harbinger of custom kerbal creation

IDK, we've had kerbalizer, and different Kerbals in video and non playable roles for a while now. I think it's meant to happen one day thought.

Oh, great, now I've gotta write character stories for them. I'll be back...

Or for others, it is possible retcons are in order where kerbals with different names have played the same roles. Perhaps it would be best to wait to see if they appear in an up coming video, so we get some proper insight into their characters.

Edited September 20, 2014 by Tw1
I think Walt wears the HAZMAT suit to protect himself from intense radiation generated by spotlights camera crews use. They are nuclear powered

That makes absolutely no sense that he is the PR guy then, he should definitely be the Science guy.

Protection against flamewars? Community-Manager-Joke-Reference?

Protection against flamewars? Community-Manager-Joke-Reference?

Heh not really. They just don't want Walt to get exposed to radiation running around like a chicken without a head as a PR person would in this case. Could you imagine how stressful it is as a KSC publicist? With all the failures?

Heh not really. They just don't want Walt to get exposed to radiation running around like a chicken without a head as a PR person would in this case. Could you imagine how stressful it is as a KSC publicist? With all the failures?
